text: Antonius Hendrikus Maria "Ton" van de Ven (1 January 1944 - 16 September 2015) was a Dutch industrial designer. He was best known for being the creative director at the Efteling theme park in Kaatsheuvel. He designed many things at the theme park between the mid-1970s and early 2000s, including ten rides. Van de Ven was born in Eindhoven, North Brabant. He was married and had three children. Van de Ven died from a cerebral hemorrhage on 16 September 2015 in Tilburg. He was 71. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Deaths from cerebral hemorrhage Category:Dutch artists Category:People from Eindhoven
title: Ton van de Ven
